dcterms:creator: D. Arcos
M. Vallet-Regí
dcterms:description: Mesoporous bioactive glasses (MBGs) designed for bone grafting and skeletal regenerative therapies, exhibiting enhanced bone regenerative properties due to their high surface area and porosity.
dcterms:title: Mesoporous Bioactive Glasses (MBGs)

dcterms:creator: C. Wu
J. Chang
dcterms:description: Mesoporous bioactive glasses (MBGs) specifically designed for drug delivery applications, demonstrating structure characteristics and capabilities for drug/growth factor delivery and bone regeneration.
dcterms:title: Mesoporous Bioactive Glasses (MBGs) for drug delivery

dcterms:creator: M.P. Nandakumar
A. Cheung
M.R. Marten
dcterms:description: Escherichia coli (E. coli) DH5α strain used for viability studies and as a model organism to evaluate the proteolytic activity in the context of drug delivery systems.
dcterms:title: Escherichia coli (E. coli) DH5α

dcterms:creator: K. Haddadi
F. Moussaoui
I. Hebia
F. Laurent
Y. Le Roux
dcterms:description: Study of proteolytic activity of Escherichia coli in milk and casein breakdown, relevant for understanding the release mechanisms in drug delivery systems.
dcterms:title: Escherichia coli proteolytic activity

dcterms:creator: G. Bacci
A. Longhi
S. Ferrari
S. Lari
M. Manfrini
D. Donati
C. Forni
M. Versari
dcterms:description: Analysis of serum alkaline phosphatase (ALP) levels in osteosarcoma patients, providing prognostic significance in the context of bone cancer treatments.
dcterms:title: Serum alkaline phosphatase (ALP) levels in osteosarcoma

dcterms:creator: M.R. Filgueiras
G.P. La Torre
L.L. Hench
dcterms:description: Simulated Body Fluid (SBF) used to evaluate the bioactivity of mesoporous bioactive glasses, essential for assessing their capability to form apatite-like phases.
dcterms:title: Simulated Body Fluid (SBF)

dcterms:creator: O.P. Filho
G.P. La Torre
L.L. Hench
dcterms:description: Study on hydroxyapatite formation from bioactive glass, providing insights into the crystallization processes relevant for bone regeneration.
dcterms:title: Hydroxyapatite formation
